name: Breakfast Creek Canyon
description:
Breakfast Creek is one of the better canyons going down to Rocky Creek. The start of the creek has a couple of impressive caves. The exit is very nice walking up beautiful Rocky Creek. The trip is about 10 km. with 340 meters ascent. It is a fairly dry canyon but you get wet in the waterfall and going up Rocky Creek.

Park at Galah car park. About 500 meters before Rocky Creek Rd ends. Follow the track to -33.27341, 150.29508 and turn right, down to the creek.


R1 RR 12 meters from sling on tree. R2 slide down some slippery rock and do a 6 meters abseil from some tree roots. R3 30 meters from sling on tree. R4 5 meters from sling on log. R5 8 meters from sling on log. R6 8 meters from sling on rock. Down clime to the right.

At Rocky Creek turn right and walk upstream for about one hour to the big bend -33.28006, 150.30155 Clime up the gully. Near the top turn left and do a 10 meters exposed rock clime. Follow the track or the ridge back to the main trail and to the car.

Red tape

Beta sites

https://ozultimate.com/canyoning/track_notes/breakfast_creek.htm

Trip reports and media

Background

First recorded descent by a Springwood B.C. - SUBW party (Bob Sault, Dave Noble, Ross Bradstock, Tom Williams) on 26 Nov 77, on a trip where the objective was to explore what became known as Contradiction Canyon. Named because none of the local maps had a "Breakfast Creek" Most good maps have a "Breakfast Creek", a "Cedar Ck" etc. The party had visited the canyon just after breakfast - early surveyor Lt Col Clews had named nearby "Dinner Ck" after the place where he had dinner as well. (Kameruka Magazine Vol 16 No 2 - July 78). The trip report is here: https://www.subw.org.au/archives/press-on-regardless/contradiction-canyon/
